page.title: 18WE WERE IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK
page.content: All three of the villages in the area are mentioned in the Domesday Book as being in the Willybrook Hundred. Tansor - known then as Tansovre- was held by the King. Fotheringhay - known as Foderingeia, a place for Foddering - was held by Countess Judith Warmington - known as variously as Warmintone, Wermintone or Wormintone; the place of the followers of Worm (The Dragon or Snake) - was held by the Abbot of Petri de Burg-Peterboro, in Willybrook and in Polebrook Hundreds. (Robert Morden (1692-1727) on one of his maps uses the spelling Â£Wormington'
